alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 8:23PM CDT until April 27 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Anticipated precipitation over the next few days will cause rises on area rivers to exceed minor flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River AT Alvarado. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 108.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Overland flooding of local agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 102.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 107.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 106.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
